themes: Critique of capitalist valuation of the arts
Non-economic value of arts and culture
Need for public awareness and appreciation of the arts
Importance of accessible and widely promoted arts events
key_phrases: activities, people and resources only hold value if they are financially lucrative
the value of the arts can be financial, but it’s also much more than that
helping shape our community’s ability to see the importance of the arts outside of economic terms
more public art installations, widely promoted and accessible events
not just the city centers, but along major highways, different neighborhoods, underserved areas
barriers_identified: Overemphasis on financial value in arts appreciation
Limited geographic distribution of arts (concentration in city centers)
solutions_proposed: Facilitate an emphasis on the arts beyond economic terms
Increase quantity of public art installations
Promote and make arts events more accessible
Invite the general population into creative practice
Expand arts presence to major highways, different neighborhoods, and underserved areas
